text.text:
The staff was really nice. But that's about it.

First, my bathroom was full of mosquitoes since there was an opening hole for them. I always had to make sure that I didn't leave the light on there. The door to the bathroom also wasn't able to close fully, so they would also come into my sleeping room. But the worst thing in there was that at some daytime you could hear a bigger animal above the ceiling of the bathroom. I was always afraid a rat or something could crash in. However, I stayed because of budget reasons.

The next blow didn't wait for long. I felt a little bit sick after the first night with the aircon on. Didn't think much about it. But after the second night I was totally sick and needed to recover in that hotel room with no aircon since it obviously hadn't been cleaned and made people sick. I never had a problem with getting sick from an ac and have travelled over 9 months in tropical countries. The health issues clearly must have been from an uncleaned ac.

As soon as I was able to go, I followed Indian friends' advice and booked a reputable hotel. It was worth it.

text.text:
Radisson Goregaon is a suitable option for corporate travelers and those on business trips. While the ambience is not remarkable, the rooms, though small, are well-equipped, and the location leaves something to be desired.
Unfortunately, repairs were taking place during peak hours, which made the constant noise quite unwelcoming.
However, the staff truly deserves a five-star rating for their outstanding service. The food is exceptional; we had the pleasure of dining at Goma and enjoying the breakfast brunch at Musafir, and the quality was consistently impressive. A huge shoutout to Chef Vaibhav Gawad and his team!

Be cautious when using the Tatwa Spa and make sure to confirm the package prices to avoid paying more than expected.

displayName.text: ITC Maratha, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Mumbai

places.shortFormattedAddress: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Int'l Airport Rd, International Airport, Ashok Nagar, Andheri East, Mumbai

editorialSummary.text: Grand hotel offering refined quarters, plus upscale dining, an outdoor pool & a spa.

text.text:
This hotel truly lives up to its reputation as a luxury destination. The rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and exceptionally comfortable. The breakfast spread and overall food quality are outstanding—an absolute delight for the palate. What stood out most was the staff—extremely courteous, cooperative, and always ready to assist, with warm smiles that make you feel genuinely welcome.

Its proximity to the airport makes it an excellent choice for transit or business travelers, although do note that the surrounding locality doesn’t offer much in terms of entertainment or dining options.

I spent two days here with my sons and overall, our experience was very pleasant. However, I would like to bring one matter to the management’s attention. My 12-year-old son, an aspiring photographer, was carrying his professional camera as he had planned some photography work in Mumbai. While entering the hotel lobby, he was unexpectedly questioned about why he had a camera and was told it wasn’t allowed. I was quite taken aback by this interaction—it's surprising and disheartening to see a young student’s passion being questioned in such a setting.

Apart from this one incident, everything else about the stay was impeccable. I hope the management reflects on this for future guest experiences, especially when it involves children and their creativity.

Stayed at ITC Maratha and the overall experience was excellent. The room was spacious and well kept with all the comforts expected from a 5-star property. The lobby and verandah areas are beautifully designed, giving a warm and premium feel as soon as you enter.
I tried multiple dishes at the in house restaurant food quality and presentation were impressive, though service during peak hours was slightly slow. The outdoor view of the property is also elegant and adds to the luxury vibe.
Overall a reliable choice near the airport for both business and leisure travellers.

text.text:
Review for ITC Maratha – A Truly Memorable and Comfortable Stay

I recently had the pleasure of staying at ITC Maratha while accompanying my husband on his business trip, and I must say, the experience was nothing short of exceptional.

Right from the moment we arrived, the hospitality and warmth shown by the staff made us feel at home. The rooms were beautifully maintained and offered the perfect balance of comfort and luxury.

A special mention to Chef Patil ji, who greeted us every morning at breakfast with a warm smile and a spread of absolutely delicious food. His personal touch and attention to our preferences made every breakfast feel special and homely. It was such a delightful way to start the day!

Another big thank you to Pushpalata ji from the room service team, who took great care in keeping our room just the way we liked it. She was always polite, attentive, and ensured that every little detail was taken care of, which truly enhanced our comfort.

What touched us the most was the way ITC Maratha made my husband's birthday extra special. We were pleasantly surprised with a beautifully arranged cake, a bouquet of fresh flowers, and a lovely fruit basket waiting in our room. It was such a thoughtful gesture and made the day truly memorable for both of us.

Thank you, ITC Maratha, for a stay filled with warmth, care, and thoughtful touches. We’ll always remember this experience fondly and look forward to visiting again!

Nice rooms, beautiful gardens, well lit lobbies and alleys. Service was probably too slow or were not efficient due to hotel being fully over booked hence the rush of guest was too much for them to handle. Check-in was bit slow and had a long queue and so was the same on check out.
Had to ask for high chair of the baby for probably 6 to 7 times still unresponsive. Food was decent enough nothing too be so much to be praised off. The rooms were over booked due to glitch and hence they provided me with free upgrade which we appreciated a lot and probably that made for everything that they goofed up for. Stay was wonderful and warm with large rooms and beautiful space.

text.text:
ITC Maratha is an excellent choice for those needing a hotel right next to the airport. The location is highly convenient, making travel effortless.

The hotel maintains exceptionally high standards in terms of service and cleanliness. The spacious rooms come with a large, comfortable bed and a well-sized desk, perfect for business travelers.

One of the standout features is its heritage architecture, preserving the charm and elegance of the colonial era, which adds a unique and pleasant atmosphere to the stay.

The breakfast area is impressive—spacious, filled with natural light, and inviting. The options are extensive, catering to continental, Indian, and Asian tastes, with a solid quality across the board.

Overall, ITC Maratha delivers a refined and comfortable experience with excellent hospitality and an unbeatable location.

text.text:
Outstanding Service and Breakfast by Chef Dev at Our Business Meet

We recently hosted a business meet with around 70 guests, and the entire experience was truly exceptional largely thanks to the remarkable service and culinary expertise of Chef Dev.

From the early morning setup to the final course, everything was handled with professionalism and grace. Chef Dev welcomed everyone with a constant smile and ensured that every detail was taken care of without a hitch. His ability to respond to last-minute needs with ease and positivity made a big difference in the smooth execution of the event.

The breakfast spread was phenomenal, beautifully prepared, fresh, and thoroughly enjoyed by all our attendees. The quality of food and service exceeded expectations, making the business gathering both productive and enjoyable.

Chef Dev truly went above and beyond, and I highly recommend him for any event where great food and seamless hospitality are essential.

text.text:
A Journey Beyond Expectations – Prima Nadal

From the moment the elevator doors opened, I felt as if I had stepped into another dimension. The warm welcome from a radiant young lady—an angel in human form—set the tone for what would be an unforgettable evening. Her bright smile and graceful presence guided me to my table.

At the table, I was served by a gentleman whose politeness and efficiency perfectly matched the excellence of the meal. The Indian cuisine was simply the finest I’ve ever tasted. Combined with the elegant atmosphere and the flawless staff, the experience was nothing short of extraordinary.

Incredible India—there’s a reason for this slogan. My sincere compliments to everyone at Prima Nadal for creating such a memorable moment.

Exceptional Staff
Miss Sandhya will make you feel in heaven,
and Mr. Sandhya will make you feel at home.

Together, they create a place that feels like both.

Captain Rene F.

text.text:
Novotel is a reliable member of the Accor brand and their hotels are always dependable for a comfortable and memorable stay. Despite being in a busy locality in the city that never sleeps, this Novotel is no different.

They have an excellent breakfast buffet - continental, South Indian, a range of breads, cheeses, juices and even smoked salmon! This place is certainly underrated and more people need to know that this is a great option to consider in the Andheri area.
Gaurav’s quick and prompt service and Lakpa’s friendly assistance made it even more memorable.

The virtual key card was a happy surprise and the wireless mobile charger in the room was appreciated too.

The terrace pool with a great view of the airport was the highlight! It perfectly summarised the stay - a dash of luxury with a dose of practicality while you’re enjoying a moment in transit.

text.text:
Everything apart from the check in host lying about keys was good.
We had pre booked transport to the hotel and the drivers were waiting exactly where we were told they would be.  They took us to our hotel efficiently.

Everything including check in appeared to be okay.  I was given one key for each of our 2 rooms to share between 5 guests.  When I asked for an extra key, I was told this was not possible as there was already a key in the light system and if she issued another key, the keys already issued would stop working.  I also requested extra duvets for one of the rooms.

The hotel lifts only allow access to the floor your room is on using the key and the communal floors.  We found this out when we entered the lifts to go to our rooms on floors 2 and 5.  This had not been explained to us.

As we arrived quite late, we went straight to dinner.  This is when the key issue became a problem.  We had taken the key out of the electrical systems to ensure that we could go back to our rooms individually.  The key from the electrical system has a hole drilled into it, so does not work for the doors or the lifts.  I ended up back downstairs, spoke to another receptionist, who immediately gave me extra keys for the rooms.  Thus showing that the original receptionist had outright lied to us.

When I got back to the room, the duvets had not been delivered.  This was an hour after we first checked in.  Again a visit to the different receptionist ensured that they were delivered promptly.

The rest of the stay, although brief, was comfortable and good.

The hotel would receive maximum stars if the original receptionist had not lied and failed to get the duvets sent to the room.

editorialSummary.text: Mumbai-themed rooms in a relaxed hotel featuring a rooftop terrace with city views, plus breakfast.

text.text:
Rating: ⭐⭐ (2/5)

March 2025 Stay

Our first visit to Kemps Corner Hotel in March 2025 was a very pleasant one. We stayed for 7 days in a Luxury Queen category room, which was exceptionally spacious with a separate workstation that made our stay comfortable. The bathroom was nice, the staff was good and cooperative, and the terrace breakfast was a delightful experience. The overall atmosphere and weather were also enjoyable, making the stay truly comfortable and memorable.

August 2025 Stay

Unfortunately, our second stay in August 2025 was completely disappointing. The staff mistakenly kept my injections in a freezer instead of a refrigerator, which destroyed medicines worth about Rs. 35,000. Although the staff and manager apologized, no refund or compensation was offered for this serious negligence. The terrace breakfast was unpleasant due to the rainy weather, and the room allotted to us was much smaller than expected, even though we paid for the same Luxury Queen category. To make matters worse, the geyser was faulty — water from the shower was either scalding hot or ice cold, which made the stay very uncomfortable.

The lack of consistency in service and facilities, along with the handling of a costly mistake, turned what was once a pleasant experience into a highly disappointing one.

text.text:
I recently stayed at this hotel and had an overall disappointing experience with the senior staff. While this is not my first time staying here and was actually quite impressed the last time. While the property and some of the support staff were good, the behavior and attitude of the main reception staff left a lot to be desired.

On the day of checkout, I specifically asked for help with my luggage as my cab was already waiting. Despite making the request directly, the reception staff showed no urgency or willingness to assist. Eventually, I had to carry everything down myself. Ironically, it was the watchman and a few helping staff who immediately offered to help — far more responsive and considerate than the ones who are actually in charge of guest service.

What was more frustrating was that the senior staff often approached guests with incorrect or half-verified information, which not only caused confusion but also came across as unprofessional. It’s not acceptable to disturb guests without first getting the facts right.

For a hotel that seems to pride itself on hospitality, the lack of basic courtesy, attentiveness, and professionalism from those at the front desk was disappointing. The management seriously needs to reconsider how its senior staff interact with guests — a little accuracy and respect would go a long way.

text.text: This hotel is full of wonderful and kind people. I like that it is quaint and service oriented. It is very clean and they provide a nice selection of dishes. Their morning breakfast buffet is top notch and filling. They make the best popped corn! Everyone was superb but I must say this: Rakesh took me under his wing and made sure that I was helped in every way. He was better than having a personal butler and saw that my recovery from 2 medical procedures went well by helping me daily! Others who were special were the two ladies called Sam. They were both very helpful and plainly, quite beautiful. I felt like India was a warm pool of kind sweetness. I must mention Pal who went out of his way several times to connect my internet. There was a glitch with my box and he worked tirelessly until he made it all better. The managers on both shifts were patient and professional, very helpful. This place may be small but gosh the location and atmosphere can’t be beat IMHO. Thanks to every person including the door lady with the beautiful smile. I will return within the year and will insist on booking here!💕

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at Taj The Trees, Mumbai. From the moment I arrived, the staff was warm, professional, and extremely attentive to every detail. The ambience is modern yet serene, blending luxury with comfort perfectly.

The rooms are spacious, beautifully designed, and equipped with every amenity you could ask for. Dining here is a delight — the food is fresh, flavorful, and presented with great care. The breakfast spread, in particular, is outstanding with a wide variety of options.

A truly world-class stay in the heart of Mumbai — highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers. I will definitely return!

The rooms are spacious, beautifully designed, and equipped with every amenity you could ask for. Dining here is a delight — the food is fresh, flavorful, and presented with great care. The breakfast spread, in particular, is outstanding with a wide variety of options.

What stood out the most was the impeccable hospitality — the team goes above and beyond to ensure every guest feels valued and cared for. Whether it’s the housekeeping, front desk, or restaurant staff, everyone greets you with a smile and genuine warmth.

A truly world-class stay in the heart of Mumbai — highly recommended for both business and leisure travelers. I will definitely return!

text.text:
We celebrated my wife’s birthday with a staycation at Taj The Trees, and it was an absolutely memorable experience. From the moment we arrived, the staff made us feel truly special with their warm hospitality and attention to detail.
The property itself is stunning modern yet serene, surrounded by greenery that makes you forget you’re still in the city. The rooms are spacious, beautifully designed, and extremely comfortable.
A perfect blend of luxury, comfort, and heartfelt service. Highly recommend Taj The Trees for anyone looking to celebrate a special occasion or simply unwind in style.

text.text:
I stayed with my family at Tau The Trees, Mumbai for 2 nights in July 2025. The hotel is located in a quiet place away from the hustle and bustle of the city, with a beautiful view of greenery and mangroves.

The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. The bathrooms were also clean and modern. The staff was extremely polite and helpful, especially Mrinali ji at the reception who took care of everything.

The breakfast was delicious and varied. The pool area and lobby are very attractive. The hotel has a peaceful surrounding, but it is a bit far from the main city.

Positives:
✔ Beautiful and clean rooms
✔ Excellent staff service
✔ Delicious food and breakfast
✔ Natural environment

text.text:
Beautiful Hotel at a lovely location. Enjoyed the weekend of Independence day.
We did the booking directly with Taj. They were so helpful from the start,, Rohit the Asst Manager took care of all our needs specially for my old parents who needed a room for specially abled.
Check in process was smooth and perfect. Jasmeet had contacted us before our check in and made lovely decorations for our celebration of 85th Birthday as well as for Anniversary. Jasmeet said she was our one point contact for all our needs but unfortunately after we checked in she hardly responded to our queries.
We had booked 4 rooms. We had 2 pool facing rooms as those are the only ones for the specially abled people and 2 Mangrove view rooms which have an excellent view. You must choose mangrove view. Prachi did a very smooth check in for all our rooms.
The rooms are large and the bathroom has all ammentites. The Bathroom is designed so well that has a bath tub and separate enclosure for Toilet and bathroom.
The Houskeeping staff was very prompt. Specially Harshali who always attended to our requirements and she cleaned the rooms perfectly. Was very impressive.
The in room dining attended to all our needs and services but the timeline for serving should be improved as we had to call many times.
The hotel had made lovely arrangements for Independence day celebrations. They had tea coffee and snacks in the lobby with classical dance and music. They even had sweet dish plate in our rooms.
The Breakfast at  Shamiana was superb. The spread was fabulous with so much variety for Veg and Non veg. There were so many options in live counter for dosas, eggs, pancakes, parathas, puris, french toast etc. Maybe one day would love to drive down just for breakfast.
Maybe one improvement can be made is to have a small play area for kids which we missed.
The ground level also has banquet rooms and ballroom. This will be good for destination wedding or corporate events.
Another beautiful highlight we saw was the way the hotel security lowered the flag after sunset and completed the formality with respect. The true way to do it even when nobody is watching. Was very proud of Taj Trees

text.text: "I recently stayed at the "Hotel Solitaire". The location was great, just a short walk from the train station and close to several restaurants. My room was clean and spacious, and the bed was comfortable. The staff were very friendly and helpful, especially the receptionist who helped me with directions. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of options. The only minor issue was the thin pillows, which weren't to my preference. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area. I give it 4 out of 5 stars."

text.text:
I have visited Mumbai Central railway station multiple times, but during my recent visit, I had the opportunity to use the paid washroom facility and I was genuinely amazed. The washroom was incredibly clean, spacious, and maintained to a standard that truly felt like a 5-star hotel. It was hard to believe I was at a railway station in India...

There is ofcourse a fee to use the facility but the cleanliness, comfort, and hygiene are well worth it. This experience gave me a deep sense of pride in how far our railway infrastructure has come.

India is truly progressing, and initiatives like these are a reflection of that growth. These thoughtful and impactful upgrades are not just services they are contributions to nation-building.

Kudos to everyone involved. Thank you for making public spaces better, more dignified, and inspiring confidence in every citizen and traveler.

text.text:
Urbanpod, located right on Platform 1 of Mumbai Central Railway Station, is a hidden gem for anyone traveling by train. Whether you’re catching an early morning departure or just need a place to freshen up and rest for a few hours, this place is spot on.

The pods are clean, well-maintained, and futuristic, with comfy beds, charging points, a small TV, and just the right amount of space and privacy. The bathrooms and washrooms are spotless, modern, and hygienic—perfect if you’ve had a long journey and need to clean up.

It’s ideal for solo travelers looking for a safe, quiet, and budget-friendly place without even leaving the station. The system runs smoothly, and everything is super convenient.

Highly recommend if you're in transit through Mumbai Central!

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Trident hotel , and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations. From the moment I arrived, the staff was incredibly welcoming, professional, and attentive to every detail.

The room was spotless, spacious, and beautifully decorated — with all the modern amenities needed for a comfortable stay. The bed was exceptionally comfortable, and the view from my room was stunning.

What truly stood out was the service. Every team member I interacted with went above and beyond to ensure my stay was perfect. Room service was prompt and delicious, and the housekeeping staff kept everything immaculate.

The hotel’s location is also ideal — close to key attractions, yet peaceful and quiet. The in-house restaurant served outstanding food with a great variety of options, and the breakfast buffet was one of the best I’ve experienced.

text.text:
I want to start with! Thank you to every staff member in Trident! So coming back to Bombay for four nights with our one year old we chose to stay here and what a wonderful decision it has been! My baby fell ill during our stay in Mumbai and Trident staff has not been less than a genie who does everything in their power to make you and your child feel comfortable! They made every possible effort for us! And honestly that touched me through and through! The nicest of staff this hotel has! All the restaurant staff, breakfast, even check ins and valet ! Even the guys at security were trying to make my girl smile and yes he did succeed!

We requested for milk every night they without needing a reminder place it in our room for us with all necessary items!
I have stayed in multiple hotels but when it comes to your baby you want to choose easy, this is easy!
Everyone has been so so kind and warm! Their smiles makes you want to smile! This place is home away from home

Location is amazing! Keeps us connected to everything

text.text:
Fantastic hotel!

Having stayed here this hotel is exotic in its interiors, fresh and grand rooms with a fantastic view of the Airport.

Breakfast and Dinner buffets have vast spreads and they have impeccable service. Full of amenities like full stocked gym, steam, sauna with locker rooms.

Good new option in close proximity to the airport.

Only con is that the approach Road is not wide and remains stuck with traffic which makes difficult for cabs to come.

Recommend for a luxurious business or leisure stay.

text.text:
Review: A Flawless Stay at the New Fairmont Mumbai – A True Masterpiece

From the moment we stepped into the Fairmont Mumbai, it was evident that this hotel is in a league of its own. The grandeur of the all–Art Deco design is breathtaking—timeless, sophisticated, and executed with precision in every detail. The caliber of the facilities is nothing short of extraordinary. From the rooms to the common spaces, every corner of the property exudes elegance and modern luxury. I simply could not be more positive about what this hotel has to offer.

What truly sets the Fairmont Mumbai apart, however, is the service and the culinary experience. The hospitality was unmatched—every interaction with the team felt warm, thoughtful, and refined. The staff were not only attentive, but intuitive, anticipating needs before they were even voiced. Their attention to detail and genuine commitment to guest satisfaction elevated the entire experience.

Each of the hotel's venues is a destination in itself. The tea room was serene and refined, offering a perfectly curated experience. The bar was stylish and vibrant, with an exceptional cocktail list and atmosphere to match. And the restaurants—plural, because each one is distinctly impressive—offered immense volume in terms of variety, flavour, and quality. The food was impeccable, showcasing culinary craftsmanship and an eye for presentation.

In every respect—design, service, cuisine, and ambiance—the Fairmont Mumbai delivers excellence. It is not just a new hotel; it is a new benchmark for luxury in India. An absolute triumph.

text.text: The hotel and its processes are perfectly fine and well set. However it's the staff that is learning to get things right. Despite booking airport view room, the room provided did not have the view of the tarmac, not even a single airplane was visible. It was only after I complained, they changed the room. Food was the best part of the stay. The breakfast spread and Sunday brunch variety were the best India might have. Will definitely stay again despite the lousy service provided by the staff. Hope swimming pool works next time I visit.

Absolute honesty and professionalism — rare and commendable.

Entry does take time and cars wait on the slope but the experience after getting in is good!

text.text:
I had a very disappointing experience during my recent stay, which fell far below the standards one would expect from a brand of your reputation.

There was no proper reception or welcome upon arrival.

The lift was extremely slow, adding unnecessary delays.

The kettle provided in the room was made entirely of plastic, with no steel lining inside. Boiling water in plastic is a serious health concern and completely unacceptable.

Room service was unresponsive and unprofessional. I requested plates and was informed they were chargeable and had to be collected by myself – this does not align with any standard of good hospitality.

Despite paying ₹125 for 3 plates and spoons, only 2 plates were delivered. When I called to follow up, there was no response and no one came back to resolve the issue.

I also ordered coffee, but it was never delivered.

For the amount we paid, the service and amenities were severely lacking. I will be sharing this experience with my organization and recommending that we do not book with your property in the future. No one should have to go through such poor service.

text.text:
The hotel is located in a prime area, which is definitely a plus. The rooms are neat and clean, and overall the stay was comfortable.

However, there are a few things that could be improved. During early morning checkout, there was a strong unpleasant smell from the toilets in the passage area near the rooms, which was quite off-putting.

The lift is very small and can barely accommodate 2–3 people at a time, which can be inconvenient, especially during check-in or check-out.

Also, while bargaining over the phone for room rates might seem possible, sometimes the agreed rate isn’t honored upon arrival, so it’s better to confirm everything in writing beforehand.

Parking can be an issue, so it’s advisable to call ahead and inform them if you’re arriving with a 4-wheeler. They usually reserve a roadside spot by shifting a two-wheeler, but this only works if arranged in advance.

Overall, a decent place if you’re aware of these points and plan accordingly.

text.text:
Overall experience: 4/5. Green spacious property near Oberoi mall, but staff need to come together to deliver a good experience. Westin really needs to fix the house keeping security gap, pre-arrival experience and chef glitches. Most of the folks try harder ( like Ms.Jasmina, head of Housekeeping/Rooms, lounge staff ,the female sous chef etc) to ensure a great experience while others like the front desk, the male sous chef etc doesn't give a damn bringing down the overall experience.

More details below -

Pre-arrival Experience: 1/5. No body called and checked on the arrival time, we wanted an airport pickup which didn't happen, nobody even picked the call at their hotel number given. No response to chat either and finally when I got a call back and while conversing with a staff , she abruptly cut the call. Not a typical Marriott experience to start with, disappointing

Arrival Experience: 5/5. After the disastrous pre-arrival experience, Ms.Jasmina stepped in and fixed the experience for us, with a quick call,  an upgrade and welcomed us with providing a small cake and helped us with the occasion celebration welcome as well.

Rooms: 4.5/5. Spacious, huge rooms which is rare in Mumbai. View is off the highways and walking space around the property. Very close to Oberoi Mall.

Privacy/Safety + Housekeeping : 3/5. We had a huge security incident involving housekeeping. Ms. Jasmina again stepped in, apologized, brought the issue to the attention of the relevant people and helped sorting it out. Other than that, requests were promptly attended to, cleanliness was maintained.

Food : 4/5. We had dinner and breakfast. Dinner lacked continental and seafood. Apparently they had pasta which the team never informed us, which was surprising. The varieties were there at both time and the female sous chef was super friendly ensuring the concerns were addressed. During breakfast, they ensured we get French toast. The male sous chef ( I guess) was super rude and when I asked for koki , he said " Go, talk to the server and place the order, not to me" if so, he shouldn't hang around the food counter and ask what do people want. If he doesn't want to do what's asked, then he shouldn't ask. Bizarre behavior. During dinner, they struggled to manage the crowd. A huge container of uncooked chicken was kept in the open kitchen behind the food counters for a long time which wasn't a good health indicator.

Few glitches needs to be addressed which is evident from the other reviews as well.

I’m not sure how this hotel received so many 5-star reviews, as my experience was quite the opposite. The surrounding area is extremely congested and not accessible by car – the lanes are very narrow, and there’s no nearby parking available. We had to carry our luggage for over 1.5 km, which was very inconvenient.

The overall hygiene was disappointing. The room had a strong unpleasant odor, and we spotted cockroaches.Bed sheet smells, cleanliness was clearly not up to standard.
Would not recommend if you're looking for comfort, hygiene, or easy access.

Terrible Experience – Absolutely Not Recommended!

I had one of the worst hotel stays ever. The cleanliness was shockingly poor. Hallways were cluttered with dirty laundry bins, cleaning tools, and even construction ladders left unattended. Trash was scattered on the floor, and under the bed was filthy with bottles and dirt clearly never cleaned.

The entire place felt completely neglected, with cockroaches present—disgusting and unacceptable for any guest accommodation. The utility/storage areas were in disarray, unhygienic, and very poorly maintained.

This hotel has no sense of responsibility toward guest comfort or hygiene. Definitely not worth the money and absolutely not recommended. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place entirely.

editorialSummary.text: Luxe seafront hotel offering multiple dining options, an elegant spa & a ballroom.

text.text:
Guest Feedback – Breakfast Experience

I truly appreciate the quality of service and facilities provided by the hotel—everything is excellent except the breakfast experience.

As an international and globally recognized hotel brand, I expected the breakfast to reflect that standard. Unfortunately, it falls short in several areas:
•	The breakfast lacks international variety and is repeated every day without any change, which becomes boring and does not meet five-star expectations.
•	The food quality is not up to international standards, and there’s no care taken by the restaurant management to improve or adjust the menu.
•	The restaurant staff are friendly and professional, but the management needs to pay closer attention to guest satisfaction, especially for such an important meal.

This feedback is meant as a constructive suggestion, because I believe a hotel of this reputation should offer a more dynamic, high-quality, and internationally appealing breakfast.

text.text:
Staying at the Taj Mahal Tower was an experience I’ll never forget. We booked the Apollo Suite, and right from the moment I walked in, it felt like I was stepping into a whole different world – one of royalty and luxury.

The welcome was grand and the staff were super warm and made sure everything was perfect from the get-go.

The suite was huge, super spacious, and absolutely stunning – easily one of the most beautiful rooms I’ve ever stayed in. Every little detail was taken care of, and the room had all the modern comforts you could ask for.

The food was amazing – packed with flavor and beautifully presented. Also the service was impeccable. Everyone was so attentive and kind, always ready to help with a smile.

The entire hotel has this magical, old-world charm that makes you feel like you’re in a dream. From the architecture to the vibe, everything screams elegance.

It’s totally worth it – something you should experience at least once in your life.

text.text: Our stay at the Taj Mahal Tower, Mumbai was truly exceptional. The room was impeccably clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We loved the breathtaking view from our window and the spacious bathroom. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always going above and beyond to assist us. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of delicious options, and the room service was prompt and efficient. The hotel's location was also superb allowing full sea view from our balcony and easy access to the city center. Overall, it was a fantastic experience and we highly recommend this hotel.

Another thing, the bags to the rooms are always late.

text.text: People say this hotel offers a delicious breakfast buffet and luxurious rooms with comfortable beds and stunning views. They highlight the friendly and helpful staff, and the convenient location with easy access to the city center and nearby attractions. They also like the beautiful architecture and elegant ambiance.

The AC filters were opaque from dust.  The white walls in my room were all scuffed up, and I didn’t get a room with a window, but it had a full body mirror that wasn’t cracked.  Almost all of the lights worked, the fan in the bathroom and over the bed did too, along with the electronic key card for the door and power.  I was not able to get the TV to turn on, but there was power to the TV, cable box, and the remote batteries were good.

The AC in my room worked well, there were virtually no bugs, (saw 2 mosquitos and a moth in a week), the floors and bathroom are full tile, staff at the front desk 24/7, and the price is half of anywhere else you will find in Mumbai, Very clean for this price and I would stay here again.

If you are from a Western country and have travelled a lot on a budget, and you need a private room (assuming all the rooms are like mine), you’ll be happy.  Anyone else from a Western country, or couples, probably should find a hotel in the $50+ range for something more familiar.

P.S.  I did clean the AC air filter for them, and for myself.

text.text: I had a wonderful stay at the ITC Maratha in Mumbai. From the moment I arrived, I was impressed with the level of hospitality and service provided by the staff. The hotel is conveniently located near the airport and offers luxurious amenities, including multiple dining options, a spa, and a fitness center. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable, with all the necessary amenities. The highlight of my stay was the exceptional dining experience at the hotel's restaurant, where I was treated to delicious food and impeccable service. I would highly recommend the ITC Maratha to anyone looking for a luxurious and memorable stay in Mumbai.

text.text:
Rating: ★★★★

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel, and I must say that my experience was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment I walked through the grand entrance, I was captivated by the opulence and elegance that exuded from every corner of this magnificent hotel.

The staff at ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel were incredibly warm and welcoming, making me feel like a valued guest from the very beginning. The check-in process was seamless, and the concierge service was exceptional. They were always ready to assist me with any request, be it arranging transportation, recommending local attractions, or making dinner reservations.

The rooms at ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel were a true testament to luxury and comfort. My accommodation was spacious, beautifully furnished, and meticulously clean. The attention to detail was evident in every aspect, from the plush bedding to the state-of-the-art amenities. The bathroom was a sanctuary in itself, featuring a deep soaking tub and a rainfall shower. Additionally, the complimentary Wi-Fi and in-room dining service added convenience to my stay.

One of the highlights of my stay at ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel was undoubtedly the dining experience. The hotel boasts a range of exceptional restaurants, each offering a unique culinary journey. From traditional Indian delicacies at Peshawri to the delectable international cuisine at Pan Asian, every meal was an absolute delight. The quality of the food, presentation, and attentive staff made dining at the hotel an unforgettable experience.

ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel also offers a range of amenities and facilities to cater to every guest's needs. The fitness center was well-equipped, and the spa was a haven of relaxation. The swimming pool area was beautifully designed, providing an oasis of tranquility amidst the bustling city.

In terms of location, ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel is conveniently situated near Mumbai's international airport, making it an ideal choice for business travelers or those in transit. Despite its proximity to the airport, I was pleasantly surprised by the peaceful ambiance within the hotel premises, shielding guests from the noise of the outside world.

Overall, my stay at ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel was an experience I will cherish for years to come. The impeccable service, luxurious accommodations, exquisite dining options, and attention to detail truly set this hotel apart. I can confidently recommend ITC Maratha Luxury Hotel to anyone seeking a memorable and indulgent stay in Mumbai.

ITC Maratha is a truly exceptional hotel that exceeded all of my expectations. From the moment I arrived, I was impressed by the regal decor, the warm hospitality of the staff, and the attention to detail that was evident in every aspect of the hotel.

The rooms are spacious and beautifully designed with a perfect blend of modern amenities and traditional Indian decor. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the linens were of the highest quality, ensuring a restful night's sleep.

But what really sets ITC Maratha apart is the service. The staff go above and beyond to make sure that every guest feels welcome and taken care of. From the concierge to the housekeeping staff, everyone was friendly, helpful, and attentive to our needs.

Overall, I had an incredible stay at ITC Maratha and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a luxurious and unforgettable experience in Mumbai

text.text:
I recently stayed at Gold Fintech Hotel, and I must say it exceeded my expectations in every way. From the moment I checked in, the staff was incredibly courteous and helpful. The rooms were clean, spacious, and well-equipped with all modern amenities including fast Wi-Fi, comfortable bedding, and a great view.

The location of the hotel is ideal — close to business centers and easily accessible. The in-house restaurant served a delicious breakfast buffet with a wide variety of options, both Indian and continental.

The hotel maintains high standards of cleanliness and security, which made me feel very comfortable throughout my stay. Special thanks to the front desk and housekeeping teams for their prompt service.

Whether you're visiting for business or leisure, I would highly recommend Gold Fintech Hotel for a pleasant and hassle-free experience.

The Goldfinch Hotel Mumbai is a 4-star establishment located in the area of Andheri East, Mumbai. The hotel is known for its elegant furnishings and attention to detail, ensuring maximum comfort for its guests.
the courteous staff, clean rooms, and the hotel's convenient location.
It offers a range of amenities, including:

Free parking

Wi-Fi

Rooftop pool

Fitness center

Free breakfast

Airport transportation

Conference facilities

Rooms are equipped with air conditioning, flat-screen TVs, minibars, and complimentary toiletries.
The hotel features on-site dining options, including the Gallery Café, which offers a variety of Indian and international cuisines. Guests have praised the quality of food and the dining experience. Nearby attractions include Frankly Mumbai Tours and Big Cinemas Sangam.

text.text:
Aurika, by Lemon Tree Hotels, is a luxurious and contemporary property located in the vibrant city of Mumbai. This upscale hotel is designed to cater to both business and leisure travelers, offering a blend of modern amenities, comfortable accommodations, and a touch of elegance. Here’s a detailed review of my experience at Aurika:

Ambiance & Design

Upon entering Aurika, guests are greeted by a stylish and sophisticated ambiance that exudes luxury. The lobby is spacious and elegantly decorated, featuring contemporary art pieces and comfortable seating areas. The design combines modern aesthetics with a warm color palette, creating an inviting atmosphere. The hotel’s layout is well thought out, making it easy to navigate while maintaining a sense of exclusivity.

Accommodations

The rooms at Aurika are spacious, well-appointed, and thoughtfully designed. Each room features contemporary furnishings, plush bedding, and large windows that offer stunning views of the Mumbai skyline. The attention to detail is evident, with amenities such as flat-screen TVs, minibars, and coffee-making facilities enhancing the overall comfort.

The bathrooms are equally impressive, featuring modern fixtures, luxurious toiletries, and ample space. The combination of comfort and elegance makes it an ideal retreat for travelers seeking relaxation after a busy day in the city.

Dining Experience

Aurika offers a variety of dining options, catering to diverse palates. The on-site restaurants provide a delightful culinary experience with a focus on both local and international cuisines.

Aurika Café: This all-day dining restaurant serves a mix of Indian and global dishes, with an extensive buffet during breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The food is fresh, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The live cooking stations add an interactive element to the dining experience.

Rooftop Bar: The hotel features a rooftop bar that offers a stunning view of the city skyline. It's a perfect spot for evening cocktails, allowing guests to unwind while enjoying a beautiful sunset over Mumbai.

Facilities & Services

Aurika boasts a range of facilities designed to enhance the guest experience. The fitness center is well-equipped, making it easy for guests to maintain their workout routine. For those seeking relaxation, the spa offers a variety of treatments, including massages and wellness therapies, providing a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

The hotel also has well-equipped meeting rooms and banquet facilities, making it a suitable choice for business travelers or events. The staff is attentive and professional, ensuring that all guests receive personalized service throughout their stay.

Location

Situated in a prime area of Mumbai, Aurika provides easy access to major business districts, shopping areas, and popular attractions. Its location makes it convenient for both leisure and business travelers, allowing easy exploration of the city's vibrant culture and attractions.

Overall Experience

Aurika by Lemon Tree Hotels is an exceptional choice for travelers seeking luxury, comfort, and convenience in Mumbai. The combination of elegant design, modern amenities, and attentive service creates a memorable stay. Whether you’re visiting for business or leisure, Aurika ensures a delightful experience that stands out among other hotels in the city. With its top-notch facilities and a focus on guest satisfaction, I would highly recommend Aurika for anyone looking to indulge in a luxurious stay in Mumbai.

text.text:
I recently stayed at Aurika Mumbai and had an absolutely wonderful experience. The property was impeccably clean, and the staff were courteous, professional, and attentive, ensuring all our needs were met promptly. I felt incredibly safe and comfortable thanks to the 24/7 security services.

A standout feature was the breakfast buffet. It offered a wide variety of options, both vegetarian and non-vegetarian, including pancakes, dosas, parathas, and freshly baked goods. Pushpaji and her team went above and beyond to accommodate my family's dietary restrictions, and the food was consistently fresh and delicious.

Overall, I was deeply impressed by the hospitality and attention to detail, and I felt truly at home here. I will definitely be returning for a longer stay in the future. Highly recommended!

text.text:
Excellent short stay near the airport although not much else within walking distance. Checkin and out was smooth,  rooms were well appointed, clean and spacious. TV wasn't working but we werent there to watch much tv. Breakfast had a variety of options to suit all palates (spicy and non-spicy).

We had time to check out the spa and glad we did.  90min of Balinese massage was superb and I could not resist going back again the next day for 60min and a 30min Indian head massage - bliss!  They also offer salon services but I did not try.

Overall, the hotel service was great throughout, and there was a young lady Roshini at front-of-house who was particularly attentive and charming with a genuinely warm smile.  Thank you for making our stay so lovely!

text.text:
I recently stayed at Novotel and would have given a perfect 5 star rating, but I’m giving it 4 stars for the service due to one minor service issue. Overall, my experience was excellent — the rooms were comfortable, the food was outstanding, and the service was mostly excellent.

A special mention goes to the restaurant and the quality of the food, which deserves a 5/5. Sous Chef Tejas made my dining experience truly memorable. He personally came over every day to ask what special dish he could prepare for me. His kindness and attention made me feel genuinely cared for, and I really appreciated his effort.

There was just one incident which I experienced  — I had to ask three different staff members for water. The first was distracted on the phone, the second walked away and didn’t return, and only the third finally brought it after I explained I had already asked twice. I brought this to the attention of the floor manager on the same day, and I hope it's taken as constructive feedback for improvement.

That said, all other aspects of the service were excellent — truly 5  out of 5. This was my second visit to Novotel in the last six months, and I will definitely return. I highly recommend this hotel to others.

text.text:
Had booked 17 rooms for my group from Southeast Asia at Hotel Kemps Corner. This is a nice blue-themed boutique hotel in a converted heritage building at the busy Kemps Corner junction. The lift is ancient with old buttons but works well.

Pros -
- Clean rooms with clean bedding and linen
- Two water bottles (a lot of hotel skimp on these) with complimentary snacks and a Frooti
- Nice lobby area with plenty seating in a nostalgic setting
- Friendly and polite staff throughout the breakfast and for room service.
- Breakfast spread was good (upma, poha, vada, chutney, sambhar), a dosa & omelette counter, breads, jams, bread spreads, chicken sausages on order, bottled drinks, juices, coffee, tea
- Plenty of parking for dropoffs, pickups and short time.
- Cute resident cat named Manu

Cons -
- Small rooms (but sufficient enough)
- Aircon didn't really cool the room as expected, but the fan made up for it
- Inexperienced staff at the lobby who did the check-in

text.text:
A Perfect Stay for Our Large Party – Exceptional Service and Comfort!

We booked about 20 rooms at Hotel Kemps Corner for a weekend in December for our wedding party, and it was a fantastic experience from start to finish! The hotel’s warm, family-friendly vibe and top-notch service made all the difference for our large group.

The staff was incredibly accommodating and easily handled our group’s needs, shout out to Padmini and her team. They were always friendly and efficient, from managing room preferences to assisting with last-minute requests. They truly went the extra mile to make everyone feel comfortable.
The hotel is spotless! Rooms were clean and well-maintained, with fresh linens and tidy bathrooms. The common areas were equally well-kept, which made the stay pleasant for all our guests. The only caveat is that the hotel is going through some paint job and some rooms have a smell.
It was easy for guests to interact and enjoy the time together either on the terrace or the reception area downstairs.
The complimentary breakfast spread was excellent – hot, fresh, and with plenty of options to suit different tastes. The hotel also provided complimentary evening snacks, which was such a thoughtful and appreciated touch.

One of the standout features was the complimentary foot massage during breakfast!
Hotel Kemps Corner is a perfect underrated choice if you're planning a family gathering or any stay in Mumbai. Great service, spotless rooms, and thoughtful extras made our wedding weekend unforgettable. Highly recommend!

text.text:
An old and forgotten hotel beautifully restored and turned into a chic boutique hotel.

I was lucky to stay here on a rainy weekend in December at an unbeatable price - perhaps the lowest you could get something of this good quality.

The staff was super nice, the breakfast was perfect (kadak chai and poha without excess sugar) and the colorful decor is simply a delight!

I can't wait to come back here for another staycation.

text.text:
Our stay at The Trees was nothing short of extraordinary. From the moment we stepped into the grand lobby, we were enveloped in an atmosphere of luxury and warmth. The check-in process was seamless, with the staff ensuring that every detail of our stay was meticulously taken care of.

Our room was a sanctuary of comfort and elegance, with plush furnishings, a sumptuous bed, and breathtaking views of the city skyline. The attention to detail was impeccable, from the softest linens to the indulgent amenities provided.

The culinary experience in the in room dining surpassed all expectations. The attentive staff catered to our every need, ensuring that our dining experience was nothing short of perfection.

The hotel's facilities were equally impressive, with a state-of-the-art gym, rejuvenating spa, and inviting pool area. We indulged in a refreshing swim in the crystal-clear waters of the pool.

But what truly sets The Trees apart is its exceptional service. Every member of the staff went above and beyond to ensure that our stay was unforgettable but I would want to specially mention Rani, Aryan, Om and  Darshan.

All through our stay we were taken care of by Mr Neeraj Mahindra who went above and beyond his call of duty to ensure our and our little one's comfort.
In conclusion, our stay at The Trees was an unforgettable experience. We left feeling rejuvenated, pampered, and already planning our next visit.
If you're looking for a luxurious haven in the heart of comfort, look no further than The Trees.

Taj The Trees is a true oasis of luxury and tranquility, offering an exceptional experience that seamlessly blends nature with sophistication. Nestled amidst lush greenery, this hotel provides a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life.

From the moment you arrive, you are enveloped in an atmosphere of elegance and warmth. The architecture and design of the hotel beautifully integrate with the natural surroundings, creating a harmonious and inviting ambience. Every corner of Taj The Trees exudes charm and grace, making it a visual delight.

The rooms are a perfect blend of comfort and style, offering breathtaking views of the verdant landscape. Each room is thoughtfully designed, providing modern amenities while maintaining a connection to the natural beauty outside.

The dining experience at Taj The Trees is nothing short of extraordinary. The diverse menu features a delightful array of culinary masterpieces, crafted with the freshest ingredients and presented with artistic flair. Whether you’re enjoying a lavish breakfast or a gourmet dinner, every meal is a feast for the senses.

The service at Taj The Trees is impeccable. The staff are attentive, courteous, and always ready to go the extra mile to ensure your stay is perfect. Their dedication to providing personalized and thoughtful service truly sets this hotel apart.

In conclusion, Taj The Trees offers an unparalleled experience of luxury and tranquility. With its stunning surroundings, exquisite dining, and outstanding service, it is the perfect destination for a rejuvenating and memorable stay.

text.text:
Taj The Trees, Mumbai, is a luxurious hotel nestled in the verdant surroundings of Vikhroli, offering guests a harmonious blend of modern sophistication and natural serenity. This collaboration between the Tata Group and the Godrej Group stands as a testament to refined elegance and ecological sustainability.

Accommodation: The hotel boasts 151 spacious rooms and suites, each thoughtfully designed to provide comfort and style. Guests can enjoy panoramic views of the Mumbai shoreline and the lush mangrove forests, creating a tranquil retreat from the bustling city.

Dining: Culinary enthusiasts will appreciate the diverse dining options available:

Shamiana: An all-day dining restaurant offering a variety of multi-cuisine dishes in an elegant setting.

Nonya: Specializing in authentic pan-Asian cuisine, this restaurant promises a delightful gastronomic journey.

The Mangrove Bar: Located on the rooftop, it provides a perfect ambiance for cocktails and light bites, complemented by stunning views.

Wellness and Recreation: For relaxation and rejuvenation, guests can visit the J Wellness Circle spa, which offers a range of therapeutic treatments. The hotel also features a state-of-the-art fitness center and an infinity-edge swimming pool, ensuring a holistic wellness experience.

Meetings and Events: Taj The Trees provides bespoke banquet facilities with both indoor and outdoor spaces, making it an ideal venue for business meetings, conferences, and social gatherings. The hotel's commitment to excellence ensures every event is executed flawlessly.

Sustainability: Emphasizing ecological responsibility, the hotel integrates sustainable practices throughout its operations, aligning with the environmental ethos of both the Tata and Godrej Groups.

In summary, Taj The Trees, Mumbai, offers a luxurious and serene escape, combining world-class amenities with a commitment to environmental sustainability. Whether for business or leisure, guests are assured an exceptional stay marked by impeccable service and thoughtful design.

text.text:
I have visited Mumbai Central railway station multiple times, but during my recent visit, I had the opportunity to use the paid washroom facility and I was genuinely amazed. The washroom was incredibly clean, spacious, and maintained to a standard that truly felt like a 5-star hotel. It was hard to believe I was at a railway station in India...

There is ofcourse a fee to use the facility but the cleanliness, comfort, and hygiene are well worth it. This experience gave me a deep sense of pride in how far our railway infrastructure has come.

India is truly progressing, and initiatives like these are a reflection of that growth. These thoughtful and impactful upgrades are not just services they are contributions to nation-building.

Kudos to everyone involved. Thank you for making public spaces better, more dignified, and inspiring confidence in every citizen and traveler.

Urbanpod Hotel, located in Mumbai's Andheri suburb, is India's pioneering pod hotel, offering a unique blend of modernity, comfort, and affordability. Designed to cater to both business and leisure travelers, Urbanpod provides a futuristic lodging experience that stands out in the hospitality landscape.

Accommodation: The hotel features 140 sleek and well-maintained pods, each thoughtfully designed to maximize space and functionality. Guests can choose from various pod categories, including Classic Pods, Private Pods, exclusive Ladies-Only Pods, and Suite Pods suitable for couples. Each pod is equipped with amenities such as a cozy bed, personal reading light, power sockets, USB ports, mood lighting, personal safe, complimentary Wi-Fi, and a satellite TV with headphone facility. The adjustable air-conditioning and air-purifier ensure a comfortable environment, while the sliding door with secure keycard access provides privacy and security.

Facilities: Urbanpod emphasizes cleanliness and hygiene, with modern, well-maintained communal bathrooms that are regularly serviced. The chic cafeteria offers a complimentary breakfast and serves as a social hub where guests can relax, read, or network with fellow travelers. Additional services include a 24-hour reception, free business center usage, personal lockers, ironing facilities, laundry services, and free toiletries.

Location: Strategically situated near Mumbai's Domestic and International Airports and the Chakala Metro Station, Urbanpod offers convenience for travelers. Its proximity to key transportation hubs makes it an ideal choice for those with early flights

text.text:
The Trident Hotel in Mumbai is a luxurious haven that seamlessly blends contemporary elegance with warm Indian hospitality. Located in the heart of the city's bustling business district, this five-star hotel offers a tranquil escape from the urban chaos.

Upon entering the lobby, guests are greeted by a sophisticated ambiance, characterized by modern design elements and impeccable attention to detail. The spacious and well-appointed rooms provide a serene retreat, boasting panoramic views of the city skyline or the Arabian Sea. The tasteful decor reflects a harmonious fusion of traditional Indian motifs and international aesthetics.

Dining at the Trident is a gastronomic delight, with a diverse range of culinary options that cater to every palate. From authentic Indian delicacies to international cuisine, each dish is a masterpiece crafted with precision and passion. The hotel's attentive staff adds a personal touch to the dining experience, ensuring every guest feels pampered.

Beyond its lavish accommodations and exquisite dining, the Trident Hotel offers state-of-the-art facilities, including a rejuvenating spa, a well-equipped fitness center, and a sparkling swimming pool. The hotel's commitment to sustainability is evident in its eco-friendly practices, contributing to a responsible and eco-conscious hospitality experience.

Whether you're a business traveler seeking a seamless stay or a leisure guest indulging in luxury, the Trident Hotel Mumbai promises an unforgettable experience where opulence meets warmth in the vibrant tapestry of India's commercial capital.

text.text:
We recently had the pleasure of staying at the newly opened Fairmont Mumbai Sahar, and I must say, it exceeded my expectations on every front. From the moment you enter, the architecture, interiors, and the sheer grandeur of the property make it clear that this is not just another 5-star hotel – it’s a true luxury retreat right in the heart of Mumbai.

Location & Convenience
One of the biggest advantages is its proximity to the airport – it's literally a 5-minute drive from the international terminal, which is a game-changer if you're flying in or out at odd hours. Despite being so close to the airport, once you're inside, it's peaceful and quiet – a perfect blend of convenience and calm.

Rooms & Views
The rooms are spacious, elegantly designed, and thoughtfully equipped with everything a modern traveler could need. My room had a lovely view overlooking the landscaped pool and garden area (was under maintenance) The bed was supremely comfortable, linens were high-quality, and the bathroom (with its fab bathtub)

Dining Experience at The Merchants
A special shoutout to Sutanuka, who helped us with our restaurant reservations at The Merchants. Her warmth, efficiency, and attention to detail made the entire dining experience feel personalized and memorable. The buffet spread at The Merchants was nothing short of spectacular – especially for vegetarians, which is often overlooked at luxury hotels. From Indian to Mediterranean and Asian cuisine, the variety was impressive. And the dessert station? A dream come true. Beautifully presented, and even better tasting – especially the mini pastries and the live ice cream counter!

Coffee & Cakes at Madeleine De Proust
Another gem within the hotel is their patisserie and café, Madeleine De Proust. Here, Ambika, the manager, was absolutely delightful. She knew her menu inside out and recommended some fantastic options. The cakes are some of the best I’ve had in Mumbai – light, moist, and not overly sweet. Their signature chocolate cake and the hazelnut éclair deserve a special mention. The coffee too – smooth, strong, and served just right.

Interiors & Architecture:
Every corner of the Hotel has thoughtful and extremly inspiring forms of art. From paintings to sculptures. Beautifully designed Interiors makes the place warm, hospitable but exciting!

Overall Experience
The service across the hotel was consistently warm and polished – the kind you expect from a Fairmont but rarely see executed so well in a newly launched property. Every staff member, from concierge to housekeeping, seemed genuinely invested in making guests feel welcome.

Final Thoughts
Whether you're a business traveler needing to stay close to the airport, or someone just looking to enjoy a weekend of luxury and pampering in the city, Fairmont Mumbai Sahar is a phenomenal choice. It’s rare to find a hotel that combines stunning design, exceptional service, and culinary brilliance under one roof – and this one does it seamlessly.

Already looking forward to my next stay.

Booking online was super easy. Upon arrival, the front desk staff greeted us warmly, and Ms. Aparna escorted us to our room. Since my wife has mobility issues, she kindly upgraded our room to one closer to the lift, ensuring easy access. Our checked-in luggage was bought by great staff didn't had to wait in the lobby for checked in or luggage

During dinner, Chef Richard Saldana personally greeted us and went above and beyond to accommodate my wife's gluten-free requirements, even preparing a special dish for dinner and breakfast the next day. The room was fantastic, with a stunning view of the airport runway. Overall, our stay was exceptional, thanks to the staff's attentiveness and care.

Inside the elevator stood a staff member solely to press floor buttons for guests!! Standing for hours with no chair, no break in sight. How difficult is it to put one chair for a human? It felt deeply inhuman and unnecessary. If a hotel cannot treat its employees with basic dignity, how can it truly respect its guests? Luxury means nothing without humanity. This practice must be reconsidered.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the exquisite Tajmahal Tower, and I must say that it was a truly unforgettable experience. From the moment I arrived, I was struck by the hotel's stunning architecture and elegant design.

The staff at Tajmahal Tower were incredibly welcoming and attentive, always going above and beyond to ensure that my stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. Whether I needed recommendations for local restaurants or help with arranging transportation, they were always happy to assist me.

My room was simply stunning, with luxurious furnishings and breathtaking views of the surrounding area. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and the amenities provided were top-notch. I particularly appreciated the high-speed Wi-Fi and the large flat-screen TV, which made it easy to stay connected and entertained during my stay.

One of the highlights of my stay was the hotel's world-class spa, which offered a range of indulgent treatments and relaxation areas. I spent several hours there during my stay, and came away feeling refreshed and rejuvenated.

Another standout feature of Tajmahal Tower was the outstanding dining options. The hotel's restaurants served up some of the most delicious and innovative dishes I've ever tasted, and the attentive service and beautiful surroundings made every meal a memorable experience.

Overall, I cannot recommend highly enough. From the impeccable service to the luxurious amenities and stunning design, it truly exceeded all of my expectations. If you're looking for a truly unforgettable luxury hotel experience, the place to be.

Overall, I cannot recommend highly enough. From the impeccable service to the luxurious amenities and stunning design, it truly exceeded all of my expectations. If you're looking for a truly unforgettable luxury hotel experience, the place to be.

text.text:
We recently hosted a family event at the Golden Room, Old Wing of Taj Palace Mumbai, and the experience was nothing short of exceptional. While we didn’t stay at the hotel, the impeccable service, outstanding food quality, and warm hospitality left a lasting impression on us and our guests.

From the moment we arrived, the staff ensured every detail was flawlessly executed, making the event seamless and enjoyable. The culinary excellence was evident in every dish—perfectly crafted flavors, top-notch ingredients, and impeccable presentation. The ambiance of the Golden Room, with its timeless elegance, added a touch of grandeur to our celebration.

Our family and friends had a truly memorable time, and we couldn’t have asked for a better venue. Taj Palace Mumbai continues to uphold its legendary reputation, making it a perfect choice for any special occasion. Highly recommended!

text.text:
Staying at the Taj Mahal Tower was an experience I’ll never forget. We booked the Apollo Suite, and right from the moment I walked in, it felt like I was stepping into a whole different world – one of royalty and luxury.

The welcome was grand and the staff were super warm and made sure everything was perfect from the get-go.

The suite was huge, super spacious, and absolutely stunning – easily one of the most beautiful rooms I’ve ever stayed in. Every little detail was taken care of, and the room had all the modern comforts you could ask for.

The food was amazing – packed with flavor and beautifully presented. Also the service was impeccable. Everyone was so attentive and kind, always ready to help with a smile.

The entire hotel has this magical, old-world charm that makes you feel like you’re in a dream. From the architecture to the vibe, everything screams elegance.

It’s totally worth it – something you should experience at least once in your life.

text.text: Our stay at the Taj Mahal Tower, Mumbai was truly exceptional. The room was impeccably clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We loved the breathtaking view from our window and the spacious bathroom. The staff were incredibly friendly and helpful, always going above and beyond to assist us. The breakfast buffet had a wide variety of delicious options, and the room service was prompt and efficient. The hotel's location was also superb allowing full sea view from our balcony and easy access to the city center. Overall, it was a fantastic experience and we highly recommend this hotel.
